Exhibits visible anxiety and confusion before re-entering the public eye, indicating internal struggle and doubt.
Seeks reassurance from bandmates about the reunion and their appearance, showing some uncertainty but also openness.
Acknowledges the significance of the moment and responds politely and with humility to Howard’s praise.
Smiles and poses with others despite feeling pressured and fake, showing effort to maintain appearances.
Thanks Howard for sticking by her and acknowledges his support sincerely.
Pushes back against Howard’s sentimentality with teasing but affectionate banter.
Expresses being jittery and on edge but shares those feelings openly with friends Mari and Ali.
Hugs, smiles, and kisses the Akergirls upon meeting them, engages in friendly banter and compliments their new record sincerely.
Averts her eyes and swiftly exits the room when a sensitive subject (Zelda) arises, avoiding direct confrontation.
Apologizes politely and shows confusion when opening Vivvy’s door mistakenly.
Seeks emotional support by inviting Zelda and other women to join her in a 'seance' for reassurance.
Appears anxious and uncertain but tries to create a positive, supportive group atmosphere by organizing a circle and holding hands.
Organizes a prayer circle, includes all women, and expresses reliance on the strength of others for support.
Leads a ritual with silence and chanting that others do not immediately join, yet persists quietly until others follow.
Expresses heartfelt gratitude to her group, acknowledges her own struggles, and shows emotional awareness.
Seems hesitant to speak, then chooses to leave instead of engaging further in the conversation.
Happily swoops up Tama and is overjoyed to see her mom play for a crowd
Breaks down inwardly when Tama kisses her, showing vulnerability and emotional openness
Admits causing pain and apologizes sincerely, showing self-awareness and regret
Faces her supporters with shame and nervousness but accepts their love and support
Nods weakly to Mari's question, indicating vulnerability but acceptance.
Reassures Howard that she is ready to go on stage despite uncertainty.
Holds hands and faces with Mari and Ali before the show, showing connectedness and mutual support.
In past interaction, looks Howard in the eye and challengingly questions him ('Who the fuck are you to want to work with a star like me?'), showing toughness and withholding trust.
States she never went on stage exposed and alone because she never knew how, revealing insecurity about solo performance.
Tells Howard 'It's okay. I'm ready to go' confidently when he hesitates to introduce the band.
Nods weakly when asked if they are okay, showing some vulnerability or lack of strength in the moment.
Allows Ali and Mari to support and hold her when she struggles, accepts their encouragement.
Freezes on stage in front of the crowd, shows vulnerability and reliance on bandmates.
Catches Tama's thumbs up with a kiss and puts it in her pocket, showing appreciation and affection.
Embraces Ali and Mari warmly for a pre-show pose, clearly happy and glowing in the spotlight.
Jokes with Howard on stage, showing playful teasing without malice.
Acknowledges her dependence on others and publicly appreciates the women beside her, showing sincerity and humility.
Invites former band members to join her onstage to help her with the finale, openly expressing her love and vulnerability.
Admits she hasn’t done this in a while and shows some insecurity about performing, displaying honesty and openness.
Engages the crowd with humor and spontaneity, acknowledges others' contributions, invites peers on stage to join her, demonstrating social awareness and collaboration.
Admits to feeling 'pee shy' and not having consulted bandmates about the finale, showing some uncertainty and lack of preparation.
Despite being 'wired' and possibly under influence, remains fun, energetic, and workable rather than a disaster, indicating resilience and ability to perform under pressure.
Hugs each one and makes eye contact with key people in the balcony, showing connection and acknowledgement.
Puts her arm around Zelda and publicly calls to 'Cut the bullshit and love each other,' working to bury rivalry.
Pulls the women in, huddles to share a plan, fostering collaboration.
Exchanges warm and loving looks with Mari and Ali before performance.
Falls into a loving embrace with Mari and Ali after the performance.
Hugs all of them and the moment feels complete.
Intervenes quickly to intercept Danny and reconnect with her daughter Tama.
Holds and comforts her daughter, promises to be better for her.
